intro: Borreria wunschmannii, commonly known as the Mexican mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It thrives on various host trees, primarily in arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are berries that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Borreria wunschmannii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for birds and insects.
